etymologies: late 16th century (as a verb): from re-‘again’ + call, suggested by Latin revocare or French rappeler ‘call back’

definitions: bring (a fact, event, or situation) back into one's mind; remember

examples.text: I can still vaguely recall being taken to the hospital
Annie recalled the event that led to the rift in their friendship
he recalled how he felt at the time
“He was awfully fond of teasing people,” she recalled

shortDefinitions: bring fact, event, or situation back into one's mind

definitions: cause one to remember or think of

examples.text: the film's analysis of contemporary concerns recalls The Big Chill

shortDefinitions: cause one to remember or think of

definitions: bring the memory or thought of someone or something to (a person or their mind)

examples.text: the smell of a black-currant bush has ever since recalled to me that evening

shortDefinitions: bring memory or thought of person or thing to

definitions: call up (stored computer data) for processing or display

examples.text: students can recall templates or stored formats

shortDefinitions: call up stored computer data for processing or display

definitions: officially order (someone) to return to a place

examples.text: the Panamanian ambassador was recalled from Peru

shortDefinitions: officially order someone to return to place

definitions: select (a sports player) as a member of a team from which they have previously been dropped

examples.text: the Fulham defender has been recalled to the Welsh squad for the World Cup

shortDefinitions: select sports player as member of team from which they have previously been dropped

definitions: (of a manufacturer) request all the purchasers of (a certain product) to return it, as the result of the discovery of a fault.
shortDefinitions: request all purchasers of certain product to return it, as result of discovery of fault

definitions: bring (someone) out of a state of inattention or reverie

examples.text: her action recalled him to the present

shortDefinitions: bring someone out of state of inattention or reverie

definitions: revoke or annul (an action or decision)

examples.text: he sent another note to Lord Grey recalling his earlier communication

definitions: an act or instance of officially recalling someone or something
shortDefinitions: act or instance of officially recalling person or thing

definitions: the removal of an elected government official from office by a petition followed by voting.
shortDefinitions: removal of elected government official from office by petition

definitions: the action or faculty of remembering something learned or experienced

examples.text: people's understanding and subsequent recall of stories or events

shortDefinitions: action or faculty of remembering something learned or experienced

definitions: the proportion of the number of relevant documents retrieved from a database in response to an inquiry.
shortDefinitions: proportion of number of relevant documents retrieved from database in response to inquiry
